text:
With the onset of summer, the government should arrange adequate public drinking water points to help the people.

G. Sathyanarayanan Iyer,

Thanjavur

Fence the toilet

The toilet at the ration shop at Annai Anjugam Nagar in Kumbakonam should be fenced. In the absence of fence, anti-social elements use the building. A toilet should be built for the benefit of the public.

K. Santhanam,

Kumbakonam

Spruce up

Mahamaham wells

I am a senior citizen, with vision and hearing impairment. During the mahamagam festival, I took a dip in the tank for five days. The arrangements were good, but the temporary bus stands were not well connected with feeder services. The location of the public toilets could have been better planned. Previously, there was less number of devotees and taking bath in the 20 wells did not pose a problem. Can these wells be spruced up and maintained well for Masi Maham every year?

V. Srinivasan,

Thiruppanandal

Stray dog menace

Stray dog menace is on the rise at Chettimandapam area causing much nuisance to residents. The local body should take steps to check the problem

S. Lakshmi,

Kumbakonam

Mark lanes, put up

speed-breakers

The roundabout at No. 1 Tollgate needs lane marking and preferably traffic signals. The speed-breakers need to be painted as per the rule. The expanded roads have been encroached upon with parked vehicles obstructing the view of oncoming vehicles for the driver. I hope the authorities will sort these issues soon.

T.M. Ranganathan,

Srirangam

Problems during

processions

Funeral processions create traffic snarls. Some mourners burst crackers on the way and throw away garlands on overhead power cables. I appeal to the corporation to take appropriate steps to solve this problem.

Aravind K. Rao,

Srirangam

Run more trains on

Madurai-Punalur line

Trains service between Tiruchi and Thiruvananthapuram is inadequate. There are two trains that start at midnight and midday. If the Madurai-Punalur passenger was extended as Tiruchi-Punalur Express, it will be a good option for passengers. Please introduce some more trains on this route.

Deepu Krishna,

Tiruchi

Bad road

Puthanampatti is 30 km from Tiruchi. Buses are operated from Tiruchi to Puthanampatti via SH 62 via Thiruvellarai and Omanthur. The 12-km road from Thiruvellarai to Puthanampatti via Saalappatti, Sirugudi, and Omanthur is in bad condition. Motorists, especially two-wheelers, suffer because of dangerous pits, soil accumulation, and gravel erosion in this State highway. Two sharp curves at Sirupathur pose a threat. I request the authorities to take action to asphalt the road.

Saravanan Natesan,

Puthanampatti

More schemes

for women

A nation which does not respect women will never be great. Accordingly, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa has given great recognition to women by reserving 50 per cent of the seats in local bodies. Introduction of women commandos, encouragement to women athletes and schemes for women would be a great help for women’s emancipation and development.

R. Pichumani,

Thippirajapuram

Poor finishing mars

Mahamaham book

On account of the Mahamaham, the Department of Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment released a 256-page Kumbakonam Mahamaham-2016 special issue. The magazine consists Kumbakonam profile, including details of several temples and theertham, besides several valuable devotional articles. But due to lack of proper binding, the sheets were loose. There were several spelling errors.

M. Baluswamy,

Kumbakonam

Long-pending

demand ignored

There is a huge demand for 45 years for introducing a day train between Tiruchi and Bengaluru, especially from senior citizens such as myself. Often we cannot get reservation in the existing train even one month in advance.

S. Shankar,

Vayalur Road

Have a clean

poll campaign

Political parties should desist from distributing money among voters during the election. They should desist from promising freebies. Canvassing should be done without disturbing traffic and exam going children.

G. Nallasivan,

Tiruchi
title: Streamline water supply in Thanjavur
